value.name: Zendesk
value.description: Zendesk is a SaaS suite that offers help desk ticketing, issue tracking, and customer service support.

inputDescriptors.name: Account name
inputDescriptors.description: Zendesk account name like https://<account name>.zendesk.com

inputDescriptors.name: User name
inputDescriptors.description: The Zendesk user name of a user who will update tickets

inputDescriptors.name: API token
inputDescriptors.description: The Zendesk API token (can be found in Zendesk app in Admin > Channels > API)

actions.name: Create a private comment in a ticket
actions.description: Create a private comment in a ticket

value.name: Zapier
value.description: Zapier enables you to automate tasks between 200+ online services. Note: Subscriptions for this service must be created and managed at zapier.com.

actions.name: Send notification
actions.description: Send event information to the specified Zapier subscription URL.

inputDescriptors.name: Subscription URL
inputDescriptors.description: The URL on zapier.com that the notification POST will be sent to.

actions.name: Post via HTTP
actions.description: This action posts a JSON object representation of the event to the specified URL. Secure, HTTPS endpoints are recommended due to the potential for private data in the event payload. Learn More

inputDescriptors.name: URL
inputDescriptors.description: The URL to which an HTTP POST will be sent.

inputDescriptors.name: HTTP headers
inputDescriptors.description: HTTP header keys and values separated by a colon(e.g. "Key1:value1") with each key-value-pair appearing on its own line of text.

inputDescriptors.name: Basic authentication username
inputDescriptors.description: Enter a username for standard HTTP authentication.  Basic HTTP authentication sends credentials in plain text (unencrypted) which means you should use a URL beginning with "https" to enable encryption of these credentials via secure transport layer (SSL).

inputDescriptors.name: Basic authentication password
inputDescriptors.description: Enter a password for standard HTTP authentication.  Basic HTTP authentication sends credentials in plain text (unencrypted) which means you should use a URL beginning with "https" to enable encryption of these credentials via secure transport layer (SSL).

inputDescriptors.name: Resource details to send
inputDescriptors.description: Control the resource fields to send

inputDescriptors.name: Messages to send
inputDescriptors.description: Control the messages to send

inputDescriptors.name: Detailed messages to send
inputDescriptors.description: Control the detailed messages to send

value.name: UserVoice
value.description: UserVoice integrates easy-to-use feedback, helpdesk, and knowledge base management tools in one platform that empowers users to speak and companies to understand

actions.name: Send linked work item event
actions.description: Send linked work item events to UserVoice

inputDescriptors.name: URL
inputDescriptors.description: The URL to which the liked work item event will be sent

inputDescriptors.name: Authorization token
inputDescriptors.description: The authorization token to use while sending the event to UserVoice

inputDescriptors.name: User token (need one? Get it now)
inputDescriptors.description: Your user token provided by Trello.  Click the link in the action description above to learn how to obtain this token.

actions.name: Create a list
actions.description: This action creates a list on an existing board in Trello. A list is used to organize cards on a board and typically represents a state. Learn More

inputDescriptors.name: Board
inputDescriptors.description: The name of the board on which the Trello list will be created.

inputDescriptors.name: Create at bottom of board
inputDescriptors.description: Indicates if the list should be created at the bottom of the board, instead of the top.

actions.name: Create a card
actions.description: This action creates a card on an existing list in Trello. A card can represent a task, issue, event, or just about anything. A card's state is typically determined by what list it is on. Learn More

inputDescriptors.name: Board
inputDescriptors.description: The name of the board on which the Trello card will be created.

inputDescriptors.name: List
inputDescriptors.description: The name of the list on which the Trello card will be created.

inputDescriptors.name: Labels
inputDescriptors.description: A comma-separated list of label colors to apply to the created card. Valid label color names are red, orange, yellow, green, blue, and purple.

inputDescriptors.name: Create at top of list
inputDescriptors.description: Indicates if the card should be created at the top of the Trello list, instead of the bottom.

value.name: MyGet
value.description: MyGet allows you to create and host your own NuGet feeds with your own packages and those from other package sources such as NuGet.org

actions.name: Publish NuGet package to MyGet
actions.description: Publish NuGet package produced in a build to a MyGet feed

inputDescriptors.name: Feed
inputDescriptors.description: The MyGet private or public feed where to publish the packages

inputDescriptors.name: Package source identifier
inputDescriptors.description: The MyGet package source identifier which defines the packages to publish

actions.name: Trigger a MyGet build
actions.description: Trigger a MyGet build, which is based on several conventions. Learn more.

inputDescriptors.name: Feed
inputDescriptors.description: The MyGet private or public feed where to trigger a build

inputDescriptors.name: Build source identifier
inputDescriptors.description: The MyGet build source identifier which defines the sources to build

value.name: Kato
value.description: Kato provides a messaging service for modern organizations

inputDescriptors.name: Room token
inputDescriptors.description: The token for interacting with a room using the Kato API

inputDescriptors.name: Room name
inputDescriptors.description: Room name as seen in Kato

actions.name: Post event to room
actions.description: Posts an event to a Kato room

value.name: Jenkins
value.description: Jenkins is a continuous integration server which allows building and testing software projects continuously.

inputDescriptors.name: Jenkins base URL
inputDescriptors.description: The base URL that hosts the Jenkins server

inputDescriptors.name: User name
inputDescriptors.description: The Jenkins user name of a user who is allowed to trigger the build

inputDescriptors.name: User API token (or password)
inputDescriptors.description: The user's API token, which is available in the Jenkins user configuration page. The API token is new since version 1.426. For earlier versions of Jenkins the real user password must be specified.

actions.name: Trigger generic build
actions.description: Triggers a generic Jenkins build, invoking the Jenkins build URL.

inputDescriptors.name: Build
inputDescriptors.description: The build name to trigger

inputDescriptors.name: Build token
inputDescriptors.description: The authorization token in the form of a string so that only those who know it would be able to remotely trigger this project's builds

inputDescriptors.name: Accepts parameters
inputDescriptors.description: Indicates if the build is parameterized or not (build parameters are optionally specified above)

inputDescriptors.name: Build parameters
inputDescriptors.description: Build parameters names and values separated by a colon(e.g. "param1:value1") with each name-value pair appearing on its own line of text

actions.name: Trigger Git build
actions.description: Triggers a build configured to use a Git repository using the Jenkins Git Plugin.

value.name: HipChat
value.description: HipChat provides group instant messaging for companies and teams.

inputDescriptors.name: Authorization token
inputDescriptors.description: Authorization token which allows to post messages to a room. It can be a room token which is just authorized to a given room, or a personal access token, which is authorized to all rooms that the token's owner is authorized.

actions.name: Post a message to a room
actions.description: Post a message about the event to a room in HipChat. Learn more.

inputDescriptors.name: Room
inputDescriptors.description: Room to post the message to.

inputDescriptors.name: Notify room participants
inputDescriptors.description: Whether or not this message should trigger a notification for people in the room (change the tab color, play a sound, etc). Each recipient's notification preferences are taken into account.

inputDescriptors.name: Send a detailed message
inputDescriptors.description: Post a short or detailed messages about the event.

inputDescriptors.name: Message color
inputDescriptors.description: Background color for message. Valid values: yellow, red, green, purple, gray, random (default: 'yellow')

value.name: Flowdock
value.description: Flowdock is Chat & inbox for teams.

inputDescriptors.name: Flow API token
inputDescriptors.description: The authorization token to post messages to a team inbox or a group chat. You can get the flow API Token from Flowdock (

inputDescriptors.name: Flow name
inputDescriptors.description: Flow name as seen in Flowdock

inputDescriptors.name: Send a detailed message
inputDescriptors.description: Post a short or detailed message about the event.

actions.name: Post a message to a team chat
actions.description: Post a message about the event to a team chat in Flowdock. Learn more.

inputDescriptors.name: Sender user name
inputDescriptors.description: Name of the "user" sending the message.

inputDescriptors.name: Tags
inputDescriptors.description: List of tags to be added to the message (comma separated). User tags should start with '@'. Hashtags can optionally be prefixed with "#". Tags are case insensitive.

actions.name: Post a message to a team inbox
actions.description: Post a message about the event to a team inbox in Flowdock. Learn more.

inputDescriptors.name: Subject
inputDescriptors.description: Subject line of the message (displayed as the title of the team inbox message)

inputDescriptors.name: From name
inputDescriptors.description: Name of the message sender

inputDescriptors.name: From address
inputDescriptors.description: Email address of the message sender (used to show an avatar of the sender)

inputDescriptors.name: Reply to
inputDescriptors.description: Email address for replies (used when replying to the message within Flowdock)

inputDescriptors.name: Project
inputDescriptors.description: Human readable identifier for more detailed message categorization

inputDescriptors.name: Tags
inputDescriptors.description: List of tags to be added to the message (comma separated). User tags should start with '@'. Hashtags can optionally be prefixed with "#". Tags are case insensitive.

value.name: Campfire
value.description: Campfire is like instant messaging, but designed exclusively for groups.

inputDescriptors.name: Account name
inputDescriptors.description: Account name like https://<account name>.campfirenow.com

inputDescriptors.name: API authentication token
inputDescriptors.description: API authentication token for the user that messages will be posted from. You can get this token visiting the user profile page at Campfire.

actions.name: Post a message to a room
actions.description: Post a message about the event to a room in Campfire. Learn more.

inputDescriptors.name: Room
inputDescriptors.description: Room to post the message to.

inputDescriptors.name: Send a detailed message
inputDescriptors.description: Post a short or detailed messages about the event.

value.name: Azure Service Bus
value.description: Provides integration with Microsoft Azure Service Bus, including Notification Hubs.

inputDescriptors.name: SAS connection string
inputDescriptors.description: The SAS (shared access signature) connection string to use to connect with Azure Service Bus. This connection string is available in the Azure Portal.

actions.name: Send a message to a Notification Hub
actions.description: This action sends a generic, template notification to the specified Azure Notification Hub. Learn More

inputDescriptors.name: Notification Hub name
inputDescriptors.description: The name of the notification hub to send the notification to. The name can contain only letters, numbers, periods, hyphens, forward slashes, and underscores. The name must start and end with a letter or number. The hub should already exist.

inputDescriptors.name: Tags
inputDescriptors.description: The tags expression (for targeting specific sets of devices). Learn more

actions.name: Send a message to a Service Bus Queue
actions.description: This action sends a JSON string representation of the event to the specified Azure Service Bus queue. Learn More

inputDescriptors.name: Queue name
inputDescriptors.description: The name of the queue to send the message to. The name can contain only letters, numbers, periods, hyphens, forward slashes, and underscores. The name must start and end with a letter or number. If the queue does not exists, it will be created if the specified connection string has the necessary permissions.

inputDescriptors.name: Resource details to send
inputDescriptors.description: Control the resource fields to send

inputDescriptors.name: Messages to send
inputDescriptors.description: Control the messages to send

inputDescriptors.name: Detailed messages to send
inputDescriptors.description: Control the detailed messages to send

actions.name: Send a message to a Service Bus Topic
actions.description: This action sends a JSON string representation of the event to the specified Azure Service Bus topic. Learn More

inputDescriptors.name: Topic name
inputDescriptors.description: The name of the topic to send the message to. The name can contain only letters, numbers, periods, hyphens, forward slashes, and underscores. The name must start and end with a letter or number. If the topic does not exists, it will be created if the specified connection string has the necessary permissions.

inputDescriptors.name: Resource details to send
inputDescriptors.description: Control the resource fields to send

inputDescriptors.name: Messages to send
inputDescriptors.description: Control the messages to send

inputDescriptors.name: Detailed messages to send
inputDescriptors.description: Control the detailed messages to send

value.name: Azure Storage
value.description: Provides integration with Microsoft Azure Storage

inputDescriptors.name: Storage account name
inputDescriptors.description: The name associated with your Azure storage account (e.g. https://STORAGE_ACCOUNT_NAME.queue.core.windows.net).

inputDescriptors.name: Storage account key
inputDescriptors.description: The key associated with your Azure storage account.

actions.name: Insert a message in a Storage Queue
actions.description: This action inserts a JSON string representation of the event to the specified Azure storage queue. Learn More

inputDescriptors.name: Queue name
inputDescriptors.description: The lowercase-only name of the queue to be used within Azure storage.  A queue by this name will be created if it does not already exist.

inputDescriptors.name: Message visibility timeout (in seconds)
inputDescriptors.description: Specifies the visibility timeout value, in seconds, for the enqueued message, relative to server time. The value must be larger than or equal to 0, and cannot be larger than 7 days, or 604,800 seconds. The visibility timeout must be set to a value smaller than the message's time-to-live value.

inputDescriptors.name: Message time-to-live (in seconds)
inputDescriptors.description: Specifies the time-to-live interval for the queue message, in seconds. The maximum time-to-live allowed is 7 days, or 604,800 seconds.

inputDescriptors.name: Resource details to send
inputDescriptors.description: Control the resource fields to send

inputDescriptors.name: Messages to send
inputDescriptors.description: Control the messages to send

inputDescriptors.name: Detailed messages to send
inputDescriptors.description: Control the detailed messages to send

value.name: AppVeyor
value.description: Continuous Integration service for Windows developers that securely builds and tests code in parallel and then deploys successful bits to on-premises or cloud environments

actions.name: Trigger a AppVeyor build
actions.description: Trigger a AppVeyor build Learn more

inputDescriptors.name: Webhook ID
inputDescriptors.description: The Webhook ID that uniquely identifies a project in AppVeyor database

inputDescriptors.name: Project name
inputDescriptors.description: Project name in AppVeyor
